</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company
repurchases its Class A common stock in open market transactions.&#160; In March 2006, the Company completed its $1.5
billion two-year Class A common stock repurchase program, acquiring 49.1
million Class A shares at an average price of $30.57 per share.&#160; During 2006, repurchases under the $1.5
billion program were 8.5 million shares at a cost of $250 million, or $29.42 per
share.&#160; Additionally, in March 2006, the
Company began a $2.0 billion Class A common stock repurchase program, which is
expected to run through 2008.&#160; During
2006, the Company repurchased 30.2 million shares of its Class A common stock,
under its $2.0 billion authority, at a cost of $1.0 billion, an average price
of $33.06 per share.&#160; During 2005, the
Company repurchased 39.2 million shares of its Class A common stock at a cost
of $1.2 billion, an average price of $30.65 per share.&#160; During 2004, the Company repurchased 21.5
million shares of its Class A common stock at a cost of $700 million, an
average price of $32.49 per share.&#160; </font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Class B common
shares issued and outstanding at December 31, 2006 and 2005 were 1.18
billion.&#160; Altria Group, Inc. held 276.5
million Class A common shares and all of the Class B common shares at December
31, 2006.&#160; There are no preferred shares
issued and outstanding.&#160; Class A common
shares are entitled to one vote each, while Class B common shares are entitled
to ten votes each.&#160; Therefore, Altria
Group, Inc. held 98.5% of the combined voting power of the Company&#146;s
outstanding capital stock at December 31, 2006.&#160;
At December 31, 2006, 161,915,095 shares of common stock were reserved
for stock options and other stock awards.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">22</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='22',FILE='C:\fc\33214559106_D11113_1669854\3021-3-mo-05.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Feb  2 21:46 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">KRAFT FOODS INC.
and SUBSIDIARIES<br>
NOTES to CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 27.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note 11.&#160; Stock Plans:</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Under the Kraft
2005 Performance Incentive Plan (the &#147;2005 Plan&#148;), the Company may grant to
eligible employees awards of stock options, stock appreciation rights,
restricted stock, restricted and deferred stock units, and other awards based
on the Company&#146;s Class A common stock, as well as performance-based annual and
long-term incentive awards.&#160; A maximum of
150 million shares of the Company&#146;s Class A common stock may be issued under
the 2005 Plan, of which no more than 45 million shares may be awarded as
restricted stock.&#160; In addition, in 2006,
the Company&#146;s Board of Directors adopted and the stockholders approved, the
Kraft 2006 Stock Compensation Plan for Non-Employee Directors (the &#147;2006
Directors Plan&#148;).&#160; The 2006 Directors
Plan replaced the Kraft 2001 Directors Plan.&#160;
Under the 2006 Directors Plan, the Company may grant up to 500,000
shares of Class A common stock to members of the Board of Directors who are not
full-time employees of the Company or Altria Group, Inc., or their
subsidiaries, over a five-year period.&#160;
Shares available to be granted under the 2005 Plan and the 2006
Directors Plan at December 31, 2006, were 143,669,750 and 481,555,
respectively.&#160; Restricted shares
available for grant under the 2005 Plan at December 31, 2006, were 38,669,750.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Generally, stock options are granted at an exercise price equal to the
market value of the underlying stock on the date of the grant, become exercisable
on the first anniversary of the grant date and have a maximum term of ten
years.&#160; However, the Company has not
granted stock options to its employees since 2002.&#160; </font></p>

<h1 style="font-weight:normal;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 45.35pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Stock
Option Plan</font></i></h1>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Stock option
activity was as follows for the year ended December 31, 2006:</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">12,978,151</font></p>

  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="69" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:51.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">31.00</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="69" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:51.6pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4&nbsp;years</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="69" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:51.6pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$61&nbsp;million</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="327" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:245.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Exercisable at December
  31, 2006</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:11.95pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="69" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:51.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">12,978,151</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">

  <td width="327" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="16" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="69" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="16" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="7" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="62" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="16" style="border:none;"></td>

</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.7pt;text-indent:-27.35pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The total intrinsic value of options exercised was $6.7 million, $0.6
million and $3.4 million during the years ended December 31, 2006, 2005 and
2004, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.7pt;text-indent:-27.35pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Prior to the initial public offering (&#147;IPO&#148;), certain employees of the
Company participated in Altria Group, Inc.&#146;s stock compensation plans.&#160; Altria Group, Inc. does not intend to issue
additional Altria Group, Inc. stock compensation to the Company&#146;s employees,
except for reloads of previously issued options.&#160; The reload feature on Altria Group, Inc.
stock options will cease during 2007.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.7pt;text-indent:-27.35pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Pre-tax compensation cost and the related tax benefit for Altria stock
option awards for reloads totaled $3 million and $1 million, respectively, for
the year ended December 31, 2006.&#160; The
fair value of the awards was determined using a modified Black-Scholes
methodology using the following weighted average assumptions for Altria Group,
Inc. common stock:</font></p>

options to purchase the following number of shares of Altria Group, Inc. stock
at December 31, 2006:</font></p>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h1 style="font-weight:normal;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.7pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-27.35pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Restricted Stock Plans</font></i></h1>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.7pt;text-indent:-27.35pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company may grant shares of restricted stock and rights to receive
shares of stock to eligible employees, giving them in most instances all of the
rights of stockholders, except that they may not sell, assign, pledge or otherwise
encumber such shares and rights.&#160; Such
shares and rights are subject to forfeiture if certain employment conditions
are not met.&#160; Restricted stock generally
vests on the third anniversary of the grant date.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.7pt;text-indent:-27.35pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The fair value of the restricted shares and rights at the date of grant
is amortized to expense ratably over the restriction period.&#160; The Company recorded pre-tax compensation
expense related to restricted stock and rights of $139 million (including the
pre-tax cumulative effect gain of $9 million from the adoption of SFAS No.
123(R)), $148 million and $106 million for the years ended December 31, 2006,
2005 and 2004, respectively.&#160; The
deferred tax benefit recorded related to this compensation expense was $51 million,
$54 million and $39 million for the years ended December 31, 2006, 2005 and
2004, respectively. The unamortized compensation expense related to the Company&#146;s
restricted stock and rights was $184 million at December 31, 2006 and is
expected to be recognized over a weighted average period of 2 years.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.7pt;text-indent:-27.35pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s restricted stock and rights activity was as follows for
the year ended December 31, 2006:</font></p>

<div align="center" style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">24</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='24',FILE='C:\fc\33214559106_D11113_1669854\3021-3-mo-05.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Feb  2 21:46 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">KRAFT FOODS INC.
and SUBSIDIARIES<br>
NOTES to CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.7pt;text-indent:-27.35pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The weighted&#150;average grant date fair value of restricted stock and
rights granted during the years ended December 31, 2006, 2005 and 2004 was $200
million, $200 million and $195 million, respectively, or $29.16, $33.26 and
$32.23 per restricted share or right, respectively.&#160; The total fair value of restricted stock and
rights vested during the years ended December 31, 2006, 2005 and 2004 was $123
million, $2 million and $1 million, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 27.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note 12.&#160; Earnings Per Share:</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Basic and diluted
EPS from continuing and discontinued operations were calculated using the
following: </font></p>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For the years
ended December 31, 2006, 2005 and 2004, the number of stock options excluded
from the calculation of weighted average shares for diluted EPS because their
effects were antidilutive was immaterial.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">25</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">KRAFT FOODS INC.
and SUBSIDIARIES<br>
NOTES to CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 27.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note 13.&#160; Income Taxes:</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Earnings from
continuing operations before income taxes and minority interest, and provision
for income taxes consisted of the following for the years ended December 31,
2006, 2005 and 2004:</font></p>

  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="148" colspan="8" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:111.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(in&nbsp;millions)</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>

  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="32" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:24.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1,274</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During 2006, the United States Internal Revenue Service concluded its
examination of Altria Group, Inc.&#146;s consolidated tax returns for the years 1996
through 1999 and issued a final Revenue Agents Report on March 15, 2006.&#160; Consequently, Altria Group, Inc. reimbursed
the Company in cash for unrequired federal tax reserves of $337 million and
pre-tax interest of $46 million ($29 million after-tax).&#160; The Company also recognized net state tax reversals
of $39 million, resulting in a total net earnings benefit of $405 million for
the year ended December 31, 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The loss from
discontinued operations for the year ended December 31, 2005, includes
additional tax expense of $280 million from the sale of the sugar confectionery
business. &#160;The loss from discontinued
operations for the year ended December 31, 2004, included a deferred income tax
benefit of $43 million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">At December 31,
2006, applicable United States federal income taxes and foreign withholding
taxes had not been provided on approximately $3.2 billion of accumulated
earnings of foreign subsidiaries that are expected to be permanently
reinvested.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">In October 2004, the American Jobs Creation Act (&#147;the Jobs Act&#148;) was
signed into law.&#160; The Jobs Act includes a
deduction for 85% of certain foreign earnings that are repatriated.&#160; </font>In 2005, the Company repatriated
approximately $500 million of earnings under the provisions of the Jobs
Act.&#160; Deferred taxes had previously been
provided for a portion of the dividends remitted.&#160; The reversal of the deferred taxes more than
offset the tax costs to repatriate the earnings and resulted in a net tax
reduction of $28 million in the consolidated income tax provision during 2005.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">26</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<div>


<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">KRAFT FOODS INC.
and SUBSIDIARIES<br>
NOTES to CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The effective
income tax rate on pre-tax earnings differed from the U.S. federal statutory
rate for the following reasons for the years ended December 31, 2006, 2005 and
2004: </font></p>

 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="482" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:361.75pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 30.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Foreign rate differences, net of repatriation
  impacts</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="25" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:19.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2.8</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="25" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:19.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(0.1</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:9.15pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="482" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:361.75pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 30.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Other</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="25" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:19.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2.1</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0.375pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="25" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:19.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2.0</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0.375pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="25" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:19.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1.5</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0.375pt 0pt;width:9.15pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="482" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:361.75pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Effective tax rate</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="25" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:19.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">23.7</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 2.25pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="25" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:19.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">29.4</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 2.25pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="25" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:19.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">32.3</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 2.25pt 0pt;width:9.15pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">The tax rate in 2006 includes a reimbursement from</font> Altria Group,
Inc. in cash for unrequired federal tax reserves of $337 million, and also
includes net state tax reversals of $39 million, due to the conclusion of an
audit of Altria Group, Inc.&#146;s consolidated federal income tax returns for the
years 1996 through 1999 in the first quarter of 2006.&#160; Included within the change in tax rates,
among other things, are a benefit of $52 million in 2006 from the resolution of
outstanding items in the Company&#146;s international operations, the majority of
which occurred in the first quarter.&#160; The
tax rate in 2005 includes the settlement of an outstanding U.S. tax claim of
$24 million in the second quarter; $82 million from the resolution of
outstanding items in the Company&#146;s international operations, the majority of
which was in the first quarter, and $33 million of tax impacts associated with
the sale of a U.S. biscuit brand.&#160; The
2005 rate also includes a $53 million aggregate benefit from the domestic
manufacturers&#146; deduction provision and the dividend repatriation provision of
the Jobs Act.&#160; The tax provision in 2004
includes an $81 million favorable resolution of an outstanding tax item, the
majority of which occurred in the third quarter of 2004, and the reversal of
$35 million of tax accruals that were no longer required due to tax events that
occurred during the first quarter of 2004.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As previously
discussed in Note 2. <i>Summary of Significant
Accounting Policies</i>, the Company&#146;s adoption of FIN 48 will result in
an increase to shareholders&#146; equity as of January 1, 2007 of approximately $200
million to $225 million.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">27</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">KRAFT FOODS INC.
and SUBSIDIARIES<br>
NOTES to CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)</font></p>

liabilities consisted of the following at December 31, 2006 and 2005:</font></p>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 27.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note 14.&#160; Segment Reporting:</font></u></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company
manufactures and markets packaged food products, consisting principally of
beverages, cheese, snacks, convenient meals and various packaged grocery
products.&#160; Kraft manages and reports
operating results through two units, Kraft North America Commercial and Kraft
International Commercial.&#160; Reportable
segments for Kraft North America Commercial are organized and managed
principally by product category.&#160; Kraft
North America Commercial&#146;s segments are North America</font> Beverages; North America Cheese &amp; Foodservice; North
America Convenient Meals; North
America Grocery; and North
America Snacks &amp; Cereals.&#160; Kraft International Commercial&#146;s operations
are organized and managed by geographic location.&#160; Kraft International Commercial&#146;s segments are
European Union and Developing Markets, Oceania &amp; North Asia.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
October 2005, the Company announced that, effective January 1, 2006, its
Canadian business will be realigned to better integrate it into the Company&#146;s
North American business by product category.&#160;
Beginning in the first quarter of 2006, the operating results of the
Canadian business are being reported throughout the North American food
segments.&#160; </font>In addition, in the
first quarter of 2006, the Company&#146;s international businesses were realigned to
reflect the reorganization announced within Europe in November 2005.&#160; The two revised international segments, which
are reflected in these consolidated financial statements and notes, are
European Union; and Developing Markets, Oceania &amp; North Asia, the latter to
reflect the Company&#146;s increased management focus on developing markets.&#160; Accordingly, prior period segment results
have been restated.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s
management uses operating companies income, which is defined as operating
income before general corporate expenses and amortization of intangibles, to
evaluate segment performance and allocate resources.&#160; Management believes it is appropriate to
disclose this measure to help investors analyze the business performance and
trends of the various business segments.&#160;
Interest and other debt expense, net, and provision for income taxes are
centrally managed and, accordingly, such items are not presented by segment
since they are not included in the measure of segment profitability reviewed by
management.&#160; The Company&#146;s assets, which
are principally in the United States and Europe, are managed
geographically.&#160; The accounting policies
of the segments are the same as those described in Note 2. <i>Summary of
Significant Accounting Policies</i>.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">28</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

and SUBSIDIARIES<br>
NOTES to CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)</font></p>

  </td>

  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s
largest customer, Wal-Mart Stores, Inc. and its affiliates, accounted for
approximately 15%, 14% and 14% of consolidated net revenues for 2006, 2005 and
2004, respectively.&#160; These net revenues
occurred primarily in the United States and were across all segments.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">29</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">KRAFT FOODS INC.
and SUBSIDIARIES<br>
NOTES to CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net revenues by
consumer sector, which includes the separation of Foodservice into sector
components and Cereals into the Grocery sector, were as follows for the years
ended December 31, 2006, 2005 and 2004:</font></p>

  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(in&nbsp;millions)</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">

  </td>

  </font>Total</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">30</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='30',FILE='C:\fc\33202257906_D11365_1669637\3021-3-mo-07.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Feb  2 20:23 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">KRAFT FOODS INC.
and SUBSIDIARIES<br>
NOTES to CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Items affecting
the comparability of the Company&#146;s continuing operating results were as
follows:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i>Asset Impairment, Exit and
Implementation Costs &#150;</i> As
discussed in Note 3. <i>Asset Impairment, Exit
and Implementation Costs</i>, the Company recorded charges for these
items of $1,097 million, $566 million and $700 million for the years ended
December 31, 2006, 2005 and 2004, respectively.&#160;
See Note 3 for the breakdown of these pre-tax charges by segment.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i>Gain on R</i><i>edemption of UB</i>&nbsp;<i>Investment</i>&#150; As more fully discussed in Note 6. <i>Acquisitions</i>, in the third quarter of 2006, the Company
acquired the Spanish and Portuguese operations of UB and rights to all Nabisco
trademarks in the European Union, Eastern Europe, the Middle East and
Africa.&#160; The redemption of the Company&#146;s
outstanding investment in UB resulted in a pre-tax gain on closing of
approximately $251 million.&#160; This gain is
included in the operating companies income of the European Union segment.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><i>Gains/Losses on Sales of
Businesses &#150;</i> During 2006,
the Company sold its rice brand and assets, pet snacks brand and assets,
industrial coconut assets, certain
Canadian assets, a small U.S. biscuit brand and a U.S. coffee plant for
aggregate pre-tax gains of $117 million.&#160;
During 2005, the Company sold its fruit snacks assets, U.K. desserts
assets, U.S. yogurt assets, a small business in Colombia, a minor trademark in
Mexico and a small equity investment in Turkey for aggregate pre-tax gains of
$108 million.&#160; During 2004, the Company
sold a Brazilian snack nuts business and trademarks associated with a candy
business in Norway for aggregate pre-tax losses of $3 million.&#160; These pre-tax (gains) losses were included in
the operating companies income of the following segments:&#160; </p>

<div align="center" style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="54" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:40.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(5</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="378" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:283.45pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Developing
  Markets, Oceania &amp; North Asia</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="54" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:40.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5</font></p>

  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">

  <td width="378" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:283.45pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 30.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(Gains) losses
  on sales of businesses</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="47" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:35.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(117</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 2.25pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(108</font></p>

  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 2.25pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">

  <td width="47" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:35.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 27.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">See Notes 5 and 6,
respectively, regarding divestitures and acquisitions.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">KRAFT FOODS INC.
and SUBSIDIARIES<br>
NOTES to CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Geographic data
for net revenues, total assets and long-lived assets (which consist of all
non-current assets, other than goodwill, other intangible assets, net, and
prepaid pension assets) were as follows:</font></p>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 27.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note 15.&#160; Benefit Plans:</font></u> </p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In September 2006, the FASB issued SFAS No. 158, &#147;Employers&#146; Accounting
for Defined Benefit Pension and Other Postretirement Plans&#148; (&#147;SFAS No. 158&#148;).&#160; SFAS No. 158 requires that employers
recognize the funded status of their defined benefit pension and other
postretirement plans on the consolidated balance sheet and record as a
component of other comprehensive income, net of tax, the gains or losses and
prior service costs or credits that have not been recognized as components of
net periodic benefit cost.&#160; The Company
adopted the recognition and related disclosure provisions of SFAS No. 158,
prospectively, on December 31, 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">SFAS No. 158 also requires an entity to measure plan assets and benefit
obligations as of the date of its fiscal year-end statement of financial
position for fiscal years ending after December 15, 2008.&#160; The Company&#146;s non-U.S. pension plans (other
than Canadian pension plans) are measured at September 30 of each year.&#160; The Company expects to adopt the measurement
date provision of SFAS No. 158 and measure these plans as of December 31 of
each year beginning December 31, 2008.&#160;
The Company is presently evaluating the impact of the measurement date
change, which is not expected to be significant.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">33</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">KRAFT FOODS INC.
and SUBSIDIARIES<br>
NOTES to CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The incremental effect of applying SFAS No. 158 on individual line
items in the consolidated balance sheet at December 31, 2006 was as follows:</font></p>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The amounts recorded in
accumulated other comprehensive losses at December 31, 2006 consisted of the
following:</font></p>

  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 2.25pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="77" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:57.95pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">40</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="77" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:57.95pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2,051</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 2.25pt 0pt;width:4.15pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company sponsors
noncontributory defined benefit pension plans covering substantially all U.S.
employees.&#160; Pension coverage for
employees of the Company&#146;s non-U.S. subsidiaries is provided, to the extent
deemed appropriate, through separate plans, many of which are governed by local
statutory requirements.&#160; In addition, the
Company&#146;s U.S. and Canadian subsidiaries provide health care and other benefits
to substantially all retired employees.&#160;
Health care benefits for retirees outside the United States and Canada
are generally covered through local government plans.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">34</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='34',FILE='C:\fc\33202257906_D11365_1669637\3021-3-mo-07.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Feb  2 20:23 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">KRAFT FOODS INC.
and SUBSIDIARIES<br>
NOTES to CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The plan assets and benefit
obligations of the Company&#146;s U.S. and Canadian pension plans are measured at
December 31 of each year and all other non-U.S. pension plans are measured at
September 30 of each year.&#160; The benefit
obligations of the Company&#146;s postretirement plans are measured at December 31
of each year.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Pension
Plans</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-45.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Obligations
and Funded Status</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The benefit obligations,
plan assets and funded status of the Company&#146;s pension plans at December 31,
2006 and 2005, were as follows:</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.15pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="422" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:316.4pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net prepaid pension
  asset (liability) recognized at December 31, 2005</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="39" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:29.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="32" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:24.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2,717</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>

</div>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">35</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='35',FILE='C:\fc\33202257906_D11365_1669637\3021-3-mo-07.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Feb  2 20:23 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">KRAFT FOODS INC.
and SUBSIDIARIES<br>
NOTES to CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The combined U.S. and non-U.S. pension plans resulted in a net prepaid
pension asset of $128 million at December 31, 2006 and $2,385 million at
December 31, 2005.&#160; These amounts were
recognized in the Company&#146;s consolidated balance sheets at December 31, 2006
and 2005, as follows:</font></p>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The accumulated benefit
obligation, which represents benefits earned to date, for the U.S. pension
plans was $5,584 million and $5,580 million at December 31, 2006 and 2005,
respectively.&#160; The accumulated benefit
obligation for the non-U.S. pension plans was $3,784 million and $3,494 million
at December 31, 2006 and 2005, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For U.S. plans with accumulated benefit obligations in excess of plan
assets, the projected benefit obligations, accumulated benefit obligations and
the fair value of plan assets were $247 million, $196 million and $11 million,
respectively, as of December 31, 2006 and $268 million, $211 million and $14
million, respectively, as of December 31, 2005.&#160;
The majority of these relate to plans for salaried employees that cannot
be funded under IRS regulations.&#160; For
certain non-U.S. plans, which have accumulated benefit obligations in excess of
plan assets, the projected benefit obligation, accumulated benefit obligation
and fair value of plan assets were $1,364 million, $1,281 million and $646
million, respectively, as of December 31, 2006, and $2,134 million, $1,993
million and $1,088 million, respectively, as of December 31, 2005. </font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following
weighted-average assumptions were used to determine the Company&#146;s benefit
obligations under the plans at December 31:</font></p>

<div align="center" style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">

  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="28" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:21.35pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">2006</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="28" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:21.35pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">2005</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:9.15pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="324" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:243.3pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Discount rate</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="28" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:21.35pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5.90</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="28" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:21.35pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5.60</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="28" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:21.35pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4.67</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="28" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:21.35pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4.44</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:9.15pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="324" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:243.3pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Rate of compensation
  increase</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="28" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:21.35pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4.00</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="28" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:21.35pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4.00</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="28" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:21.35pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3.00</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="28" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:21.35pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3.11</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:9.15pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-45.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s 2006 year-end
U.S. and Canadian plans discount rates were developed from a model portfolio of
high quality, fixed-income debt instruments with durations that match the
expected future cash flows of the benefit obligations.&#160; The 2006 year-end discount rates for the
Company&#146;s non-U.S. plans were developed from local bond indices that match
local benefit obligations as closely as possible.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">36</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">KRAFT FOODS INC.
and SUBSIDIARIES<br>
NOTES to CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-45.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Components
of Net Periodic Benefit Cost</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net periodic pension cost
consisted of the following for the years ended December 31, 2006, 2005 and
2004:</font></p>

  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="22" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:16.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">165</font></p>

  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.15pt;">

</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During 2006 and
2005, employees left the Company under workforce reduction programs, resulting
in settlement losses of $17 million and $10 million, respectively, for the U.S.
plans.&#160; In addition, retiring employees elected
lump-sum payments, resulting in settlement losses of $49 million, $73 million
and $41 million in 2006, 2005 and 2004, respectively.&#160; Non-U.S. plant closures and early retirement
benefits resulted in curtailment and settlement losses of $13 million, $25
million and $7 million in 2006, 2005 and 2004, respectively. </font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The estimated net
loss and prior service cost for the combined U.S. and non-U.S. pension plans
that is expected to be amortized from accumulated other comprehensive income
into net periodic benefit cost during 2007 are $203 million and $15 million,
respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following weighted-average assumptions were used to determine the
Company&#146;s net pension cost for the years ended December 31:</font></p>

<div align="center" style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

  </td>

</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company&#146;s expected rate of return on plan assets is determined by the plan
assets&#146; historical long-term investment performance, current asset allocation
and estimates of future long-term returns by asset class.&#160; </font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft and certain
of its subsidiaries sponsor employee savings plans, to which the Company
contributes. These plans cover certain salaried, non-union and union
employees.&#160; The Company&#146;s contributions
and costs are determined by the matching of employee contributions, as defined
by the plans.&#160; Amounts charged to expense
for defined contribution plans totaled $84 million, $94 million and $92 million
in 2006, 2005 and 2004, respectively.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">37</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">KRAFT FOODS INC.
and SUBSIDIARIES<br>
NOTES to CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

  <td width="12" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:9.15pt;">

  <td width="366" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:274.75pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="30" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:22.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="30" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:22.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3</font></p>

  <td width="12" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:9.15pt;">

  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="366" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:274.75pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="30" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:22.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">100</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 2.25pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="30" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:22.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">100</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 2.25pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="30" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:22.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">100</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 2.25pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="30" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:22.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">100</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 2.25pt 0pt;width:9.15pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company&#146;s investment strategy is based on an expectation that equity securities
will outperform debt securities over the long term.&#160; Accordingly, the composition of the Company&#146;s
U.S. plan assets is broadly characterized as a 70%/30% allocation between
equity and debt securities.&#160; The strategy
utilizes indexed U.S. equity securities, actively managed international equity
securities and actively managed investment grade debt securities (which
constitute 80% or more of debt securities) with lesser allocations to high
yield and international debt securities.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For
the plans outside the U.S., the investment strategy is subject to local
regulations and the asset/liability profiles of the plans in each individual
country.&#160; These specific circumstances
result in a level of equity exposure that is typically less than the U.S.
plans.&#160; In aggregate, the actual asset
allocations of the non-U.S. plans are virtually identical to their respective
asset policy targets.&#160; </font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company attempts to mitigate investment risk by rebalancing between equity and
debt asset classes as the Company&#146;s contributions and monthly benefit payments
are made.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company presently makes, and plans to make, contributions, to the
extent that they are tax deductible or do not generate an excise tax liability,
in order to maintain plan assets in excess of the accumulated benefit
obligation of its funded U.S. and non-U.S. plans.&#160; Currently, the Company anticipates making
contributions of approximately $16 million in 2007 to its U.S. plans and
approximately $157 million in 2007 to its non-U.S. plans, based on current tax
law.&#160; However, these estimates are
subject to change as a result of many factors, including changes in tax and
other benefit laws, as well as asset performance significantly above or below
the assumed long-term rate of return on pension assets, or significant changes
in interest rates.&#160; </font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The estimated future benefit payments from the Company&#146;s pension plans
at December 31, 2006, were as follows:</font></p>

  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

  <td width="270" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:202.15pt;">

  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  <td width="77" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:57.85pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2,392</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">38</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='38',FILE='C:\fc\33202413579_D11365_1669637\3021-3-mo-09.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Feb  2 20:24 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">KRAFT FOODS INC.
and SUBSIDIARIES<br>
NOTES to CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 27.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Postretirement
Benefit Plans</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net postretirement
health care costs consisted of the following for the years ended December 31,
2006, 2005 and 2004:</font></p>
